title: The Archers font
content:
Can you help me identify this font, or find something similar? (You may ignore the fancy wheat stalk coming out of the A.) The closest I have come is Centaur or High Tower Test. Thank you!

I will attach an image but if you want to see it in context, you can look at [http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b006qpgr](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804232711/http:/www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b006qpgr "http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b006qpgr")
author: aparente001

comments.content:
Aack! I can't find "edit." I will try comment, I see "insert image."

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804232711im_/http:/typophile.com/files/typeface-archers_4156.png)
Looks to me like good old [Adobe Caslon Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804232711/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/adobe-caslon/bold-3491/).

Thanks! I think you're right. I wanted to try it out with skyfonts, but google fonts doesn't have it, and I can't figure out how to trial it through fonts.com in skyfonts. Can anyone give step by step instructions?
I found a free version. Good enough!
Are you aware of the fact that Adobe Caslon is protected by copyright and that it is illegal to download and use free versions found online?
